p.s: The article Hope of escape lost in translation, which was published in the 17th December 2016 from Zia Haider Rahman, aan author of The Sunday Times talks about the problems the expensive campaign of Great Britain, to celebrate differences and support minorities to not learn the englishEnglish language or even integrate to the englischEnglish majority culture.
In this article Zia talks about his experiences as a part of the poor Bangladeshi community in East London.
He talks about the crime, the poverty and the low level of education leaves them only two choices: Become a muslim extremist or join one of the many gangs in London.
The author then explains how his fast learning of the language and the help of his parents and the school director helped him to integrate in Great Britain.
At the end he makes a proposition to the government he thinks the people could integrate better if they would stand on their own feet.

That means the translation funds of the government have to be cancelled and should be replaced by englishEnglish courses or other projektsprojects which helps the BangladeschiBangladeshi people to integrate.
